meanings.definition: To put on or spread again
meanings.sent1: She had to reapply the lotion on her dry skin to keep it moisturized.
meanings.sent2: The chef instructed us to reapply the glaze on the cake for a shiny finish.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally sneezed, causing him to reapply the spilled salt on the table.

meanings.definition: To make a new application or request
meanings.sent1: She decided to reapply for the job after improving her resume.
meanings.sent2: If your application was rejected, you can reapply for the position next year.
meanings.sent3: He had to reapply for the loan with additional documents to meet the requirements.
meanings.sent4: The student planned to reapply for the scholarship to fund his education.
meanings.sent5: To increase your chances, you should reapply for the grant with a stronger proposal.
